p: Methods for measuring structural complexity have also expanded rapidly in recent years with the easy access of small unmanned aerial systems (sUAS), i.e. ‘drones’. sUASs are now frequently used to construct digital elevation models (DEMs) and other types of 3D virtual models, providing new tools for exploring different ecological descriptors of various ecosystems. These include structural complexity in coral reefs ( Gonzalez-Rivero et al., 2017 ), habitat categorization in rocky shores ( Garza, 2016) and in freshwater fish habitats ( Kalacska et al., 2018 ), species distributions and biodiversity surveys in forest ecosystems ( Torossian et al., 2016 ) and thermal distribution in agricultural landscapes ( Faye et al., 2016 ).
